text: The table above shows the scores of a group of students in a physics test. If the mode is m and the number of students who scored 4 or more is n, what is (n, m)?
explanation:
The mode (m) = 4.
No of students who scored 4 and above = 12 + 10 + 6 + 4 + 1 = 33.
\(\therefore\) (n, m) = (33, 4)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A final examination requires that a student answer any 4 out of 6 questions. In how many ways can this be done?
explanation:
The question will be answered in\(^6C_4 = \frac{6!}{(6-4)!4!}\\=\frac{6!}{2!4!}\\=\frac{6\times5\times4!}{2\times1\times4!}\\=15\hspace{1mm}ways\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If the mean of five consecutive integers is 30, find the largest of the numbers
explanation:
Let the consecutive numbers be a, a+1, a+2, a+3, a+4Mean = \(\frac{(a+a+1+a+2+a+3+a+4)}{5}\)30 = \(\frac{5a+10}{5}\)30\( \times 5 = 5a + 10\)5a = 150 - 105a = 140a = 28∴ a + 4 = 28 + 4= 32
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A bag contains 5 black, 4 white and x red marbles. If the probability of picking a red marble is 2/5, find the value of x
explanation:
Black = 5White = 4Red = xTotal = 9+xP(red) = 2/5x / (9+x) = 2/55x = 2(9+x)5x = 18+2x5x-2 = 183x = 18x = 6
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the variance of 2x, 2x-1 and 2x+1
explanation:
\(\sum x = 6x\)\(\sum(x-\bar{x})^2\) = 2\(\bar{x} = \frac{\sum x}{n}\)= \(\frac{6x}{3}\)= 2xVariance = \(\frac{\sum(x-\bar{x})^2}{n}\)= \(\frac{2}{3}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: For what value of n is \(^{n+1}C_3\) = 4(\(^nC_3\))?
explanation:
\(^{n+1}C_3 = 4(^nC_3)\\\frac{(n+1)!}{(n+1-3)!3!} = 4\left(\frac{n!}{(n-3)!3!}\right)\\\frac{(n+1)n!}{(n-2)(n-3)!}=4\left(\frac{n!}{n-3!}\right)\\=\frac{n+1}{n-2}=\frac{4}{1}\\n+1 = 4(n-2)\\n+1 = 4n-8\\-3n = -9\\\frac{-9}{-3}\\n=3\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The gradient of a curve is 2x + 7 and the curve passes through point (2, 0). find the equation of the curve.
explanation:
dy/dx = 2x + 7y = ∫2x + 7y = x2 + 7x + C at (2,0)0 = 22 + 7(2) + C0 = 4 + 14 + C0 = 18 + CC = -18∴ The equation is y = x2 + 7x - 18
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Differentiate (x\(^2\) - \(\frac{1}{x}\))\(^2\) with respect to x
Find the value of x for which the function 3x\(^3\) - 9x\(^2\) is minimum
explanation:
y = 3x\(^3\) - 9x\(^2\)\(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 9x\(^2\) - 18xAs \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 09x\(^2\) - 18x = 09x(x-2) = 09x = 0 which implies x = 0x - 2 = 0 implies x = 2\(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) = 18x - 18when x = 0\(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) > 0 ∴ x is minimumwhen x = 2, \(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) = 18∴ the value > 0 x is minimum
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Calculate the logarithm to base 9 of 3\(^{-4}\) x 9\(^2\) x (81)\(^{-1}\)
explanation:
\(3^{-4}\times 9^2 \times 81^{-1}\)=\(log_9 (3^{-4}\times 9^2 \times 81^{-1})\)= \(log_9 \left(\frac{1}{3^4}\times 9^2 \times \frac{1}{81}\right)\)= \(log_9 \left(\frac{1}{81}\times \frac{81}{1}\times \frac{1}{81}\right)\)= \(log_9 \frac{1}{81}\)= \(log_9 \frac{1}{9^2}\)= \(log_9 9^{-2}\)= -2\(log_9 9\)- 2 \(\times 1\)= -2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Evaluate \(\frac{2}{6-5\sqrt{3}}\)
explanation:
\(\frac{2}{6-5\sqrt{3}} = \frac{2}{6-5\sqrt{3}} \times \frac{6+5\sqrt{3}}{6+5\sqrt{3}}\\=\frac{2(6+5\sqrt{3})}{(6-5\sqrt{3})(6+5\sqrt{3})}\\=\frac{12+10\sqrt{3}}{36-25(3)}\\=\frac{12+10\sqrt{3}}{36-75}\\=\frac{12+10\sqrt{3}}{-39}\\=-\left(\frac{12}{39}+\frac{10\sqrt{3}}{39}\right)\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Convert 2232\(_4\) to base six
explanation:
1st convert to base 102232\(_4\) = 2 x 4\(^3\) + 2 x 4\(^2\) + 3 x 4\(^1\) + 2 x 4\(^0\)= 2 x 64 + 2 x 16 + 3 x 4 + 2 x 1= 128 + 32 + 12 + 2= 174 convert to base 66/1746/29 R 06/4 R 56/0 R 4= 450\(_6\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the diagram above, QR is the diameter of the semicircle QR. Find the area of the figure to the nearest whole number. [\(\pi = \frac{22}{7}\)]
explanation:
Area of rectangle PQRS = \(10 \times 7 = 70cm^2\)
Area of semi-circle: \(\frac{\pi r^{2}}{2}\)
r = \(\frac{7}{2} cm\)
Area of semi-circle = \(\frac{1}{2} \times \frac{22}{7} \times \frac{7}{2} \times \frac{7}{2}\)
= \(\frac{77}{4} = 19.25 cm^{2}\)
Area of figure = \((70 + 19.25) cm^{2}\)
= 89.25 cm\(^{2} \approxeq\) 89 cm\(^{2}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: PQ and RS are two parallel lines. If the coordinates of P, Q, R, S are (1,q), (3,2), (3,4), (5,2q) respectively, find the value of q
explanation:
Gradient PQ, P(1,q) and Q(3,2)\(=\frac{(2-q)}{(3-1)} = \frac{(2-q)}{2}\)Gradient of RS : R(3,4) and S(5,2q)\(= \frac{(2q-4)}{(5-3)}= \frac{(2q-4)}{2} = \frac{2(q-2)}{2}\)= q-2Since PQ and RS are parallel,their gradients are equal\(∴ \frac{(2-q)}{2} = q-2\)2-q = 2(q-2)2-q = 2q-42+4 = 2q+q6 = 3qq = 2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In triangle XYZ, ∠XYZ = 15o, ∠XZY = 45o and lXYl = 7 cm. Find lYZl.
explanation:
∠yxz = 180 - (45 + 15)= 180 - 60= 120oUsing sine rule\(\frac{x}{sinx}=\frac{7}{sinz}\)\(\frac{x}{sin 120}=\frac{7}{sin 45}\)x = \(\frac{7 sin 120}{sin45}\)x = \(\frac{7sin(180-120)}{sin 45}\)x = \(\frac{7 sin 60}{sin 45}=\left(7\left(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\right)\div \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)\)x = \(\left(7\left(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\right)\div \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)\)x = 7\(\left(\frac{\sqrt{6}}{2}\right)\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the diagram above, POQ is a diameter of the circle PQRS. If ∠PSR = 145°, find x°
explanation:
∠PSQ = 90° (∠ in semi circle)∠PSQ + ∠QSR = 145°90 + ∠QSR = 145∠QSR = 145 - 90∠QSR = 55°BUt x° = ∠QSR (∠s in the same segment)∴x° = 55°
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: What is the locus of points equidistant from the lines ax + by + c = 0?
explanation:
The set of points equidistant from two parallel lines can be determined by the perpendicular distance from a point to each line.
Given the lines are of the form ax + by + k\(_1\) = 0 and ax + by + k\(_2\) = 0, the locus of points equidistant from these lines is another line parallel to them.
To find this line, which represents the equation of the locus, we need to find the average  k\(_1\) and  k\(_2\), which we shall be denoted by q
This line will have the same coefficients for x and y as the original lines.
Thus, the equation of the locus is: ax + by + q = 0
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The solution set of the shaded area above is

options.A: y ≥ 0, y ≥ x and y + x ≤ 4
options.D: y ≤ x, y + x ≤ 4 and y ≥ 0

explanation:

text: A binary operation \(\oplus\) defined on the set of real number is such that x\(\oplus\)y = xy/6 for all x, y ∈ R. Find the inverse of 20 under this operation when the identity element is 6
explanation:
x ⊕ y = xy/6 = xe/6 = xxe = 6xe = 6x ⊕ y = xx1/6 where x1 = 20x x 20/6 = 6x = 36/20x = 9/5
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If p varies inversely as the cube of q and q varies directly as the square of r, what is the relationship between p and r?
explanation:
P ∝ 1/q3P = K/q3q3 = K/Pq = K/p1/3But q ∝ r2q = Kr2K/p1/3 = Kr2r2 = K/p1/3 x 1/Kr2 = 1/p1/3r = (1/p1/3)2r = 1/p1/6r ∝ 1/p1/6 = p = \(\frac{1}{r^6}\)∴ p varies inversely as \(r^6\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A binary operation * on the set of rational numbers is defined as \(x \ast y = \frac{x^2 - y^2}{2xy}\). Find \(-5 \ast 3\)
explanation:
\(x \ast y = \frac{x^2 - y^2}{2xy}\)=\(\frac{(x+y)(x-y)}{2xy}\)-5 \(\ast 3 =\frac{(-5+3)(-5-3)}{2(-5\times3)}\)=\(\frac{-2 \times -8}{2(-5\times3)}\)=\(\frac{-8}{15}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Solve the inequalities for which \(\frac{x+4}{3}-\frac{x-3}{2} < 4\)
explanation:
\(\frac{x+4}{3}-\frac{x-3}{2} < 4\\\frac{(2(x+4))-(3(x-3))}{6}<4\)2(x+4) – 3(x-3) < 4 x 62x + 8 – 3x+9 < 24-x + 17 < 24-x < 24 – 17-x < 7x > -7

text: The cost of renovating a 6 m square room is N540. What is the cost of renovating a 9 m square room?
explanation:
Cost of removing a 6m\(^2\) room = N540Cost of renovating a 1m\(^2\) room = 540 / 6Cost of removing a 9m\(^2\) room= (540 / 6) * 9= N810
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The sum of the first n positive integers is
explanation:
Let the positive integers be 1, 2, ,3, 4, .....n∴ a = 1, d = 1 and n = nSn = n/2(2a + (n-1)d)= n/2 (2 + n – 1)= 1/2n(n + 1)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(T = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{l}{g}}\), make g the subject of the formula
explanation:
\(T = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{l}{g}}\)
\(\frac{T}{2\pi} = \sqrt{\frac{l}{g}}\)
\((\frac{T}{2\pi})^{2} = \frac{l}{g}\)
\(\therefore g = \frac{4 \pi^{2} l}{T^{2}}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If y = x\(^2\) - x - 12, find the range of values of x for which y \( \geq \) 0
explanation:
y = x\(^2\) - x - 12= (x - 4)(x + 3)∴ x = 4 or x = -3Checking the cases for y \( \geq \) 0We check values on the range x - 4 \(\geq\) 0; x + 3 \(\leq\) 0; x - 4 \(\leq\) 0 and x + 3 \(\geq\) 0 for the range which satisfies the inequality x\(^2\) - x - 12 \(\geq\) 0.
We find that the inequality is satisfied on the range x \(\leq\) -3 and x \(\geq\) 4.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: How many terms of the series 3, -6, +12, - 24, + ..... are needed to make a total of 1 - 2\(^8\)?
